channel.title: ASF Jira
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [CXF-5988] Provide support for a pluggable parameter conversion mechanism for JAX-RS client side proxies
item.description:
Server-side JAX-RS implementation allows injection of custom parameter converters using ParamConverterProvider (http://cxf.apache.org/docs/jax-rs-basics.html#JAX-RSBasics-Parameterconverters).
A similar mechanism (or the exact same) is required on the client side to control how parameters are serialized (marshalled). One approach is to allow specifying param converters when declaring jaxrs:client with Spring and/or programmatically specifying it.

A specific case to consider: Client side serialization of Date object (java.util.Date).

Given the following API:

@Path(“/someresource”)
@GET
void someApi(@MatrixParam(“”) SomeRequestWithDate request);

Following shows the structure of the request with Dates:
//----------------------------------------------------
import java.util.Date;

public class SomeRequestWithDate {
protected Date startDate;

public Date getStartDate()

{ return startDate; }

}
//----------------------------------------------------
When API is invoked through a client proxy

Then the following URL should be generated (where dates are serialized as ISO strings):

/someresource/;startDate=2014-09-04T19:05:38.785Z

Instead, currently following URL is generated:

/someresource/;startDate.date=4;startDate.hours=15;startDate.minutes=4;startDate.month=8;startDate.seconds=34;startDate.time=1409857474660;startDate.year=114;startDate.day=4;startDate.timezoneOffset=240
item.summary: Provide support for a pluggable parameter conversion mechanism for JAX-RS client side proxies

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are not closed can be reopened.

comments.comment: Have you actually tried using ParamConverters ? They are expected to work on the client side

We tried using ParamConverter with no effect. Converter code and client side configuration to register it are below:
Please note, this approach works for the server-side but not on the client-side.

// SomeDateConverter.java//
package com.my.util;
import java.util.Date;
import javax.ws.rs.ext.ParamConverter;
import org.joda.time.DateTime;
import org.joda.time.DateTimeZone;
import org.joda.time.format.DateTimeFormatter;
import org.joda.time.format.ISODateTimeFormat;

public class SomeDateConverter implements ParamConverter<Date> {
@Override
public Date fromString(String dateString) {
if (dateString.contains("-"))

{ DateTime result = ISODateTimeFormat.dateTimeParser().withZone(DateTimeZone.UTC).parseDateTime(dateString); return result.toDate(); }

return new Date(Long.parseLong(dateString));
}
@Override
public String toString(Date dateToConvert)

{ return ISODateTimeFormat.dateTime().withZone(DateTimeZone.UTC).print(dateToConvert.getTime()); }

}
// ParamConverterProviderImpl.java//
package com.my.util;
import java.lang.annotation.Annotation;
import java.lang.reflect.Type;
import java.util.Map;
import javax.ws.rs.ext.ParamConverter;
import javax.ws.rs.ext.ParamConverterProvider;

public class ParamConverterProviderImpl implements ParamConverterProvider {
private final Map<Class<?>, ? extends ParamConverter<?>> paramConverters;
public ParamConverterProviderImpl(Map<Class<?>, ? extends ParamConverter<?>> paramConverters)

{ this.paramConverters = paramConverters; }

@Override
public <T> ParamConverter<T> getConverter(Class<T> rawClass, Type genericType, Annotation[] annotations)

{ return (ParamConverter<T>) paramConverters.get(rawClass); }

}
//////////our-config.xml /////////////////
<bean id="someDateConverter" class="com.my.util.SomeDateConverter"/>
<bean id="paramConverterProvider" class="com.my.util.ParamConverterProviderImpl">
<constructor-arg>
<map>
<entry key="java.util.Date" value-ref="someDateConverter" />
</map>
</constructor-arg>
</bean>

<jaxrs:client id="someService" address="http://${somehostname}:$someport}/${somesvc}" serviceClass="com.my.SomeService" inheritHeaders="true">
<jaxrs:providers>
<ref bean="paramConverterProvider" />
</jaxrs:providers>
</jaxrs:client>

that is due to Date fields not being checked as individual properties but assumed to be beans. There's a limit in how this extension can determine if a given property is a bean or simple property. You may want to consider using JAX-RS BeanParam.
In meantime I've updated the code to treat Date as simple properties

Thanks for the fast turnaround. Would you please tell how I can download the build with the fix to use.

Regards
Srinivas
You can get it from the Maven snapshot repository

Sergey,

Are there any release dates for 3.0.2 you can share? I am waiting on two fixes (this and CXF-5744).

Thanks!

With the fix -using 3.0.2-SNAPSHOT, java.util.Date marshalled is not ISO and it bypassed the converter.
Please see the difference between with 3.0.2-SNAPSHOT and 3.0.1 Release:

Using 3.0.2-SNAPSHOT (with CXF Fix):
Address: http://somehost:someport/someservice/someentries/between;startDate=Thu%20Sep%2011%2015:01:45%20EDT%202014;endDate=Thu%20Sep%2011%2015:03:45%20EDT%202014;pageNumber=0;pageSize=200

Using CXF 3.0.1 Release (Before Fix)
Address: http://somehost:someport/someservice/someentries/between;endDate.date=11;endDate.hours=14;endDate.minutes=17;endDate.month=8;endDate.seconds=59;endDate.time=1410459479734;endDate.year=114;endDate.day=4;endDate.timezoneOffset=240;startDate.date=11;startDate.hours=14;startDate.minutes=15;startDate.month=8;startDate.seconds=59;startDate.time=1410459359715;startDate.year=114;startDate.day=4;startDate.timezoneOffset=240;pageNumber=0;pageSize=200

Please let us know if you would like me to provide more info.
Thanks
Yes - I'd like you to confirm that your custom ParamConverter is invoked and it returns a correct value
Well clearly something creates "Thu Sep 11 15:01:45 EDT2014", the question is what creates it...
Could "Thu Sep 11 15:01:45 EDT 2014" be the result of a simple toString() on a java.util.Date object?

Our custom ParamConverter is not invoked when using the api originally described like below,and it instead appears to use toString() on java.util.Date.
@GET
void someApi(@MatrixParam(“”) SomeRequestWithDate request);//custom ParamConverter not invoked

Also, to clarify, custom ParamConverter is correctly invoked when PathParam is not empty like below:
@GET
void someOtherApi(@PathParam(“someDate”) Date someDate);//custom ParamConverter is invoked

I'm afraid I can not reproduce it. Experimenting with a local test confirms a custom ParamConverter is invoked for Date properties extracted from a 'matrix' bean.
Please download the CXF source and debug. I'll keep this issue open till the end of the week.
Alternatively, provide a Maven-based test project.

Thanks, Sergey
This is Eclipse project to reproduce the issue of ParamConverter not getting invoked when using matrix param

Please find uploaded RestDemo2.7Z zipped file containing sample maven based Eclipse-project that can be used to reproduce the issue.
When UserManagerServiceTest.java is invoked, the first call - getUserBeforeDate(startDate) that passed java.util.Date directly results in invoking ParamConverter (SomeDateConverter).
However, the next call to geUserByDateRange(request) - that passes an instance of GetUserByDateRangeRequest object that in turn contains date attrbutes - does NOT invoke ParamConverter (SomeDateConverter).

It is using 3.0.2-SNAPSHOT of cxf.

Please let me know if you need any other info or if I am missing something.

Thanks
Srini

UserManager service has PathParam(""), while in earlier comments it is actually MatrixParam(""). I don't think it will even work with PathParam("") because UserManager has no template variables in getUserByDateRange, have you tried running the attached project ?

Cheers, Sergey
Fixed UserManager using matrixParam

You are right- using MatrixParam - I see the converter getting invoked correctly now - uploaded it.
Fix seems to be working.

Thanks much
OK, cool...

Verified it works with QueryParam in addition to MatrixParam.
However, using empty PathParam with DTO having java.util.Date, ParamConverter is not getting invoked.
Uploaded RestDemo2_EmptyPathParamNotWorking.7z file-
In UserManagerServiceTest.java- calling getUserByDateRange2(request) does not invoke ParamConverter.

After verifying- please let us know if you would want us to open another jira for it or address it within this.

Thanks again
Code to reproduce ParamConverter not getting invoked with empty String PathParam having java.util.Date

I've already said that 

@GET
	 @Path("/getUserByDateRange2")
	 @Produces(MediaType.TEXT_PLAIN)
	public String getUserByDateRange2(@PathParam("") @WebParam(name = "request") GetUserByDateRangeRequest2 request);	"

won't work properly because @Path has no template vars.

By the way - I'd like you to encourage ask the questions on the users list

Cheers, Sergey
This thread is related: http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/cxf-users/201602.mbox/%3C1456231795705-5766185.post%40n5.nabble.com%3E
Dennis - please watch https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/CXF-6798
